Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, interior covered with a black resinous deposit, with remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing orders for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.137-138)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87650) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87650)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 167 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
